thread.title: Daily Telegraph August 21 1915

author: The Telegraph
title: Daily Telegraph August 21 1915
text: * Download the whole paper pdf & view * (23mb) Unsurprisingly the torpedoing of the Arabic still led the news today, as the number missing increased from 33 to 46. Page 7 contained accounts from survivors, whilst page 8 reported on the generally hostile reaction to the news. Not content with its blast yesterday, the leader page ( page 6 ) was happy to print another one berating Germany for its actions at sea, no matter how repetitive this might be getting by now. Also in today’s paper - The Trade Union journal ‘The Independent’ carries an article attacking pro-German brothers as traitors – page 3 - Another fraudster comes to court on page 4 , this one claiming to be a V.C. holder. Its notable how frequently bogus soldier cases come up in the courts during this war - On the naval front Price Louis of Battenberg writes to Winston Churchill to refute aspersions cast on the latter by the leaking of a private note, whilst an E-class submarine is grounded in Denmark – page 7 - Another Polish fortress is captured by the Germans, whose announcement is taken as face value this time – page 7 - The Anzac Inventions Board in the trenches at Gallipoli is covered in today’s report, delivered from Malta – page 8 - “To the resourceful cook fritters offer one of the most useful items of her daily menu” says the women’s page ( page 10 ) which duly delivers recipes for savoury banana fritters and scallop fritters telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraphnews
